channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Mahmoud Khalil Tells His Story
item.description: The Palestinian activist discusses the Columbia protests, ICE detention and free speech in America.

item.title: Torrential Rain Batters Hong Kong, Flooding the Waterlogged City
item.description: Record-setting rain has brought chaos to parts of Hong Kong, with submerged streets, stranded buses and landslides. Residents were advised to avoid go...

item.title: A long-running anti-DEI lawsuit could help companies defend themselves from reverse-racism claims
item.description: A reverse-discrimination suit against B2B company Hello Alice has become a proving ground in the legal battle over diversity-oriented corporate progra...

item.title: On Gaza, Germany’s Government Faces Pressure from All Sides
item.description: Germany, after the Holocaust, has a special bond with Israel. But a hunger crisis in Gaza is creating a demand for Berlin to take bolder action.

item.title: The fall of Elon Musk down Fortune’s 100 Most Powerful People in Business list shows how power is impermanent
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The 5 biggest global business rivalries to watch, and how their outcomes will shape the future
item.description: Breaking down the competition in AI, energy, EVs, and more.

item.title: UN Security Council to Discuss Israel-Gaza War and Hostages
item.description: Israel called for the meeting to debate the plight of captives still held by Hamas. The discussion will take place as the humanitarian crisis in the t...

item.title: Gen Zers are flocking to these Midwest housing markets where homes are about 30% cheaper than the coasts
item.description: Seven of the 10 most affordable metros for young homeowners are in the Midwest.

item.title: Tennessee Inmate to Be Executed Despite Ethical Health Concerns
item.description: Lawyers for Byron Black, found guilty of three murders, have argued that an execution may be more painful because of his heart implant.

item.title: This Gen Zer dropped out of NYU at just 19 to launch his blockchain—now, his $1.3 billion company is backed by Mark Cuban and he never takes a day off
item.description: Eric Chen, the CEO and cofounder of financial blockchain Injective, can’t remember the last time he took a day off, and swears by a $2,900 mattress to...

item.title: Bite Club: The Fraternity That Awaits You After a Shark Attack
item.description: Very few people know what it’s like to recover, physically and emotionally, from a shark bite. But some of the ones who do are ready to help.

item.title: Record-Breaking Rain Pounds Hong Kong
item.description: Stairways have turned into waterfalls as torrential rain has battered the island for more than a week.
